column8: both at the age of 66 after ten years' service. The councillor was worse off by €16
column9: 500 per year than a Senator who had no other entitlement than an Oireachtas pension. Unlike those of us in the Oireachtas

column11: there should be an opt-in clause for those who do not pay class A PRSI in some other employment. I know the Tánaiste is interested in this because it affects more women than men

column11: there is a steady increase in the number of domiciliary care allowance payments. I am not saying it is huge but it is there. For instance
column12: during the last session we addressed the issue of children on the Asperger's syndrome and autism spectrum. We have more carers partly because of the number of older people
column13: which I think is a very good thing to stand over. That does
column15: mean that we must consider what happens to carers next. It is why I meet the Carers Association regularly.
